p: The majority of tested RSEO samples did not show inhibitory effects on S. aureus 6538P biofilm formation (a partial inhibitory effect was observed only for R6 essential oil at 3.125 mg/mL, panel A of Figure 1). On the contrary, some RSEO samples (R6, R12, R24, RM4 and RM6) were shown to enhance biofilm formation by up to 140% at 0.0488 mg/mL Differently, several RSEO samples showed a good inhibitory effect on S. epidermids RP62A biofilm production. In particular 4 out of 13 EOs (R6, R24, RM4 and RM6) were able to potently inhibit biofilm formation with a rate of about 80% at either used concentrations (panel B of Figure 1), thus these EOs were selected for further analyses using scalar concentration of each EO starting from 0.0488 mg/mL. An attempt to determine a direct dose dependent effect was not effective ( Figure 4).
